article.title: Random Sampling: a Tool for Library Research
article.author: Drott, M. Carl
article.text: Questions about the accuracy of library records, the behavior or attitudes of patrons, or the conditions of the books in the collection can often be answered by a random sampling study.. Use of this time and money saving technique requires no special mathematical ability or statistical background.. The concept of accuracy is discussed and a table is provided to simplify the determination of an appropriate sample size.. A method of selecting a sample using random numbers is shown.. Three examples illustrate the application of the technique to library problems..
